channel.title: No 'ClassPath' variables?
channel.description:
Okay, so i'm wanting to get a server up and running and on the web just for a place were me and my friends can hang around and fight each other in a more unique way than runescape... Yes I am brand new to Java I litterally thought to my self around 2am (GMT) I want to make an rsps so I looked into and have been trying for around 1-2 hours just to compile a source I have a no-ip host etc set up I just can't seem to get past the compiling when using one source O got to a stage were it said 'Press r to run server' and then when I did this I was told I don't have JDK even though I do :S + Yes I do have JRE.
Now after following this topic step by step in order to get an rsps up and running asap; I have now got stuck on the 'Setting up your Environmental Variables' part I have gone to my variables and edited my 'Path' however I now can't seem to find a 'ClassPath' anywhere on the page and when I try to compile it I am still getting, does anyone know what the problem is or where it maybe (editable):
[img]http://gyazo.com/01b5bbd1bc9e1dd4cf100acb864fb319.png[/img]
I have now decided that I want to use this source - http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,478841.0.html as there is a lot I can do if I decide to develop it for the public, however tbh I am totally stuck now and getting all stressed out just a little push in the right direction would help or if anyone could help in a little more detail as to the tutorials I have been following that would be great!
Please help! :confused:

item.title: No 'ClassPath' variables?
item.dc:creator: @Robbo1235 Robbo1235
item.description:
@Robbo1235 wrote:

[quote=“Dj Nm.E, post:11, topic:395980”][quote author=Robbo1235 link=topic=493160.msg3605604#msg3605604 date=1306084424]

Here I uploaded this for you . This is a Automatic Environmental Variable Settler.
I put 2 so use any of them. Run as administrator.

:
http://uppit.com/2m7tpovo1e95/jave_EV.rar

But when and if I go to re-install java (JDK or JRE) I already have it installed do I wish to re-install it…

Really confused but very ambitious to get this thing working don’t know what to do from here still…

Get up a server with me the owner and begin to learn and develop things! I press apply it tells me it doesn’t have the permissions

Did you try both?

I got the second one to open I got this, but i’m unsure what to do because using the Java setter isn’t shown in the tutorials?

[/quote]

what do you mean unsure…
you said you need to set your java., and thats auto setter,…
i really dont get what your trying to do(or say)[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: No 'ClassPath' variables?
item.dc:creator: @Robbo1235 Robbo1235
item.description:
@Robbo1235 wrote:

[quote=“whackatre, post:1, topic:395984”]If that doesn’t work try this:

For your compiling:

"C:\Users\Whackatre\Desktop\Java\jdk1.6.0_22\bin\javac.exe" *.java

For running:

"C:\Users\Whackatre\Desktop\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" (java program name goes here)

Of course, the name and Java versions will be different. If you have common sense you should be able to change them.[/quote]

Erm, so I basically right click the run.bat ‘edit’ then do I type that code over the current one or just underneath? + my java version is; jdk1.6.0_25 so it’s be that for the ‘(java program name goes here)’?

Read full topic
